#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Chau Doc
#Text=Chau Doc ( Châu Đốc ) is a city in the heart of the Mekong Delta , in Vietnam .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Chau Doc is best-known to travelers as a border crossing with Cambodia .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Walk : the main downtown area is an easy walk , from the riverside to the market to Chau Doc Square .
#Text=By motorcycle
#Text=Minh Kim guesthouse ( Phone : 029-66552244 , 01222225646 , Address : 622 Ton Duc Thang , Vinh My ) offers motorcycles for rent .
#Text=The price is 150,000 vnd per day .
#Text=If you will mention to the owner that you want to rent Alan 's motorcycle you will be given a semi-automatic motorcycle for 100,000 vnd per day .
#Text=The owner of the guesthouse speaks quite a good English .
#Text=See
#Text=A stroll along the riverside will be well worth it .
#Text=You will bump into many young people eager ( but a bit shy ) to engage you in conversation .
#Text=It can be very rewarding after a morning spent haggling in the colourful markets .
#Text=Do
#Text=A traditional massage with suction cups is a great way to relax and unwind before returning to Go Chi Minh City or taking one of the riverboats to Phnom Penh .
#Text=Sam Mountain ( 6 km from Chau Doc ) .
#Text=Bike to Sam Mountain : rent a bike from your hotel ( US$ 1 - 2 ) and ride 6 m to the base of Sam Mountain .
#Text=It 's an easy ride over flat paved and gravel road , just watch out for traffic .
#Text=Walk on food from the base of the mountain , up the stairs to the top .
#Text=Many viewpoints and cafe 's with hammocks along the way to stop for a drink and a rest .
#Text=Alternatively you can take a moto straight to the top of Sam Mountain , a great place to catch the sunset and see the views of Vietnam and into Cambodia .
#Text=Tra Su Bird Sanctuary ( about 25 km from Chau Doc ) .
#Text=As of January 2015 most hotels and travel agents are charging around US$ 34 for a two person trip to Tra Su ( Includes moto drivers and boat fees ) .

#Text=If you speak to any of the moto drivers around the covered market you should be able to hire one for around 150,000 - 200,000 dong per moto and can visit Sam Mountain or the Pagoda on the way back .
#Text=Some of the drivers speak good English .
#Text=Hiring a driver on your own will save about US$ 8 - 10 for a two person trip ( depending on your negotiating skills ) .
#Text=75,000 dong per person for 1½ hour visit ( includes both speed and row boat ride ) .
#Text=Buy
#Text=A large , sprawling market dominates the centre of town , with a covered section in Bach Dang street .
#Text=There are many ATM , mainly in center near the pagoda , and on Le Loi/riverside .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Thanh Tinh , 13 Quang Trung ( close to the indoor market ) . 6 am -9 pm .
#Text=A nice and clean local restaurant that serves vegan food .
#Text=Friendly and English-speaking staff .
#Text=They can also prepare take-away meals ( handy for the journey on the slow boat to Cambodia ) .
#Text=Be aware , they charged 95,000 dong for a ' com phan ' , almost three times expensive than usual price ( March 2011 ) .
#Text=Bay Bong , 22
#Text=Duong Thuong Dang Le ( With the indoor market on your right hand side , continue until you can only go left or right .
#Text=Go right there and you 'll eventually see it on your left . ) , ☏ +8476867271 .
#Text=Good food with a very long menu ; locals and visitors eat here .
#Text=The atmosphere is n't particularly romantic .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Chau Giang Floating Restaurant , Trần Hưng Đạo street .
#Text=You can get a cheap drink with a great view of the river at the Chau Giang Floating Restaurant , on the pier at the opposite end to the Victoria Hotel , near the Hang Chau ferry office .
#Text=Budget
#Text=Hang Chau II Hotel , 10 Nguyen Van Thoai , ☏ +8476868891 , +84 91 3970831 , fax : +8476865140 , ✉ hangchau2agg@hcm.vnn.vn .
#Text=Good budget option , within walking distance from the market and the river .
#Text=It 's a bit impersonal , with a lack of decorative touches throughout the building , but it also has a stately 1960s ambiance , and the rooms are big .
#Text=Parking is available .
#Text=It 's a popular destination for tour groups , so check in early . from 110,000 dong .
#Text=Thuan Loi Hotel , 18 Tran Hung Dao St. .
#Text=Has the best location out of the budget hotels , right on the river , but it 's also a tour-group stop .
#Text=Rooms have hot water and a/c . from US$ 6 .
#Text=Trung Nguyen , 86 Bach Dang .
#Text=Great staff .
#Text=Rooms are small but very clean , with hot water , a/c , and television , and cost about US$ 16 ( Jan 2015). .
#Text=Motel Number 6 Thanh Mai , 6 Phan Van Vang St , ☏ +8476867622 .
#Text=For a budget place , the atmosphere is clean and relaxing .
#Text=Potentional for bus station pick-up and Mekong slow boat/bus trip to Phnom Penh available . from US$ 5 .
#Text=Vinh Phuoc Hotel , 12-14 Quang Trung , ☏ +8476866242 , +84 76 562265 , ✉ vinhphuochotel@yahoo.com .
#Text=A great budget deal , this place is run by an amiable Brit who is an excellent source of local travel information .
#Text=Free wifi at reception From US$ 20 .
#Text=Splurge
#Text=Victoria Chau Doc Hotel , 32 Le Loi , ☏ +8476865010 , fax : +8476865020 .
#Text=A luxury hotel where you 'd least expect to find one , with no amenity left behind .
#Text=Features 92 rooms , 4 suites , and total incongruity with its surroundings .
#Text=Transfers to Phnom Penh via private speedboat are available .
#Text=Rooms from US$ 99 - 155 , river view suites from $144-$ 220 .
#Text=Connect
#Text=Get a prepaid SIM card from Mobifone ( centre , near pagoda ) or Vinaphone ( Le Loi , riverside ) : about 65,000 dong and monthly Internet package ~120,000 dong .
#Text=Have a problem with your phone , buy a new SIM card or recharge account balance , visit The Anh Mobile Service 31 Le Loi ( near Chau Doc Church , church three-way crossroads ) .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Bus station is near the entrance of city about 4 km from centre and ~15,000 dong moto taxi ride .
#Text=Can
#Text=Tho
#Text=is a popular next stop for travelers on a tour of the Mekong Delta .
#Text=Ha Tien 60,000 dong , 3½ hr , 09:00 departure on the way to Phu Quoc
#Text=Ho Chi Minh City .
#Text=Phuong Trang bus company ( phone +84 76 356 5888 ) make the connection for 125,000 dong 6 times a day between 08:45 to 00:15 .
#Text=Phnom Penh is another popular destination .
#Text=Many travelers stay for one night in Chau Doc and go the next day to Cambodia .
#Text=Several boats are available , from slow boats to fast boats .

#Text=A journey on a slow boat can take up to 10 hr to Phnom Pehn , and the quality of the boats is not always the best ( extremely noisy engine , heavy vibration , a lot of sun and no toilet can make a 10-hr trip really long ) .
#Text=You can get a visa-on-arrival at the border , it costs US$ 20 or 400,000 dong ( Feb 2010 ) .

#Text=Most likely , some of the tour operators will tell you , that they have to get the visa for you and that it is now more expensive and other lies ( such as the border crossing closes soon and they will get there faster with your passport using a motorbike , etc. ) but this is not true and you can ignore them .
#Text=Try not to take to many dong with you , because the exchange rate you get is not very fair .
#Text=There is no ATM , so bring enough dollars with you .
#Text=At the border , there is a small restaurant , but it is comparably expensive .
#Text=You can get take-away meals and a bottle of water from restaurants in Chau Doc if you plan ahead .
